tasks.task: Preparing and tilling the soil for planting
subtasks: Walking or driving a tractor to the designated field
Attaching a tiller or plow implement to the tractor
Adjusting the depth and width of the tillage based on crop requirements
Operating the tractor to pull the tiller through the field
Overseeing the turning of soil to break up clumps and remove debris
Assessing the correct planting depth and spacing for the crop
Refilling seed boxes or hoppers on the planter attachment
Starting the planter and checking for even seed distribution
Driving the tractor at the appropriate speed for planting
Monitoring seed placement, soil coverage, and ensuring proper germination rates
Checking soil moisture levels with a moisture meter or trowel sampling
Assessing the field for areas needing irrigation or dry conditions
Adjusting irrigation systems or scheduling watering based on crop needs
Selecting the appropriate tools for pruning, such as loppers or pruning shears
Removing dead or crossing branches to promote healthy growth
Ensuring proper scaffold branching structure for long-term health and yield
Gathering feed or pellets for the chickens
Opening feeders and dispensing the appropriate amount of feed
Ensuring feed is fresh and promptly removing any unused feed to prevent spoilage
Checking nesting boxes or coop areas where hens lay eggs
Gently picking up eggs, checking for cleanliness and cracks
Storing eggs properly in a basket or container for further handling
Inspecting irrigation pipes, sprinklers, or drippers for leaks or blockages
Turning on and testing irrigation systems before planting or during active growth
Ensuring adequate water pressure and even distribution across the field
Calculating the correct ratio of compost to soil or existing fertilizers
Gathering necessary materials and tools, such as shovels or mixing piles
Thoroughly mixing the compost or fertilizer into the soil to enhance nutrient content
Selecting the appropriate pesticide or fungicide based on current crop challenges
Checking for proper dilution rates and application rates
Ensuring safety equipment is worn, such as gloves, respirators, or protective clothing
Applying the pesticide or fungicide using a sprayer or other application method
Monitoring for effectiveness and reapplying as needed

tasks.task: Setup and operation of a gooseneck trailer
subtasks: Parking the tractor near the desired trailer location
Tilting the gooseneck to a safe angle for coupling
Connecting the trailer to the gooseneck hitch
Checking that all connections are secure and that the trailer is level
Weighing or measuring the required amounts of different ingredients
Loading the ingredients into a hay mixer or feed chopper
Operating the mixing mechanism to combine the feed components
Ensuring the feed is well-combined and suitable for animal consumption
Surveying the field for necessary fence lines
Selecting appropriate fence post and wire materials
Digging post holes and setting posts using a post hole digger or backhoe
Attaching the wire or electric fencing to the posts
Setting up the rotating sprinkler and ensuring it is securely placed
Adjusting the watering schedule and duration for optimal coverage
Monitoring the sprinkler for malfunctions or uneven watering patterns
Identifying areas with invasive weeds or noxious growth
Hand-pulling individual weeds or using a hoe to slice the weeds off at the base
Discarding the pulled weeds or ensuring they cannot regrow
Herding livestock, such as cattle or sheep, from one field to another
Ensuring all animals are accounted for and moving safely
Using appropriate livestock handling equipment, such as prods or gates
Checking vehicles, tools, or agricultural machinery for wear and tear
Replacing or tightening components as needed
Lubricating moving parts to prevent future malfunctions
Measuring the correct amounts of fertilizer and water
Agitating the mixture to ensure even distribution of the fertilizer in the water
Loading the mixture into tanks for application through sprayers or other systems MAINTASK: Adjusting machinery settings
Calibration of planting or harvesting equipment to ensure accurate seed placement or crop removal
Fine-tuning machinery settings for optimal performance in varying conditions

tasks.task: Removing silt or debris from irrigation channels
subtasks: Walking along irrigation channels to locate blockages or silt accumulation
Scraping or using tools to remove debris or excess silt buildup
Locating loose connections or kinks in the irrigation system
Using ties or waterproof tape to secure hoses in place and prevent leaks
Clearing out soiled bedding or manure from animal housing areas
Scrubbing or hosing down surfaces to remove foul odors and keep the area clean

tasks.task: Transferring feed from bulk to individual feeders
subtasks: Using a shovel or scoop to empty bulk feed containers into smaller individual feeders
Distributing the feed evenly across the feeders to avoid waste
Measuring and marking out rows or beds for planting
Preparing seedbeds by planting or sowing seeds directly into the ground
Watering the newly planted seeds until established

tasks.task: Preparing wood pallets for construction work
subtasks: Disassembling old pallets or collecting unused ones from the field
Cleaning the pallets of any trash or debris

Using the spade to perform vertical cuts and widen holes as needed

Disposing of the collected trash appropriately

subtasks: Calculating the necessary size or number of tarps based on hay stack dimensions

Controlling speed and depth to avoid overturning or damaging crops
